New Records: Kevin Durant surpassed 29,000 career points, becoming the eighth player in NBA history to achieve this milestone.
Key Match Events: LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists against the Sacramento Kings.
Anthony Davis scored 35 points in the Lakers' win over the Suns.
Kevin Durant scored 30 points on 11-of-17 shooting for the Suns against the Lakers.
Devin Booker added 23 points for the Suns against the Lakers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers aim to continue their best start since the 2010-11 campaign when they visit the Phoenix Suns.
Bradley Beal is expected to return for the Suns after missing the previous game due to an elbow injury.
Grayson Allen is slated to be available for the Suns after missing two games for the birth of his daughter.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis expressed confidence in the Lakers' ability to hold their own and put the league on notice.
LeBron James reflected on his performance, stating he tried to see what he had going to help the team get over the hump.
JJ Redick described LeBron James' final-quarter performance as 'surreal' and praised his continued greatness.
Kevin Durant credited his teammates, coaches, and supporters for helping him reach the 29,000-point milestone.
Devin Booker was pleased with the tenacity Phoenix displayed against the Mavericks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers have won six of the past eight meetings against the Suns.
